comments: On the newsgroup (http://www.eclipsezone.com/eclipse/forums/m92025320.rhtml?tstart=0#92025320) a question was posted about how to bind a validation error to a TitleAreaDialog's error message field.  TitleAreaDialog doesn't expose a getter for the error message.  This results in a BindingException thrown by JavaBeanObservableValue when attempting to retrieve the current value in order to populate a diff.  I'll post a JUnit showing the issue with simple java beans.

Created an attachment (id=44106)
junit displaying the issue

Stack trace:

org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.provisional.BindingException: string property does not have a read method.
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.internal.beans.JavaBeanObservableValue.doGetValue(JavaBeanObservableValue.java:102)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.internal.beans.JavaBeanObservableValue.setValue(JavaBeanObservableValue.java:83)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.internal.ValueBinding.doUpdateTargetFromModel(ValueBinding.java:274)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.internal.ValueBinding.updateTargetFromModel(ValueBinding.java:250)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.internal.ValueBinding.<init>(ValueBinding.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.provisional.factories.DefaultBindingFactory.createBinding(DefaultBindingFactory.java:53)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.provisional.DataBindingContext.doCreateBinding(DataBindingContext.java:287)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.provisional.DataBindingContext.bind(DataBindingContext.java:273)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.provisional.DataBindingContext.bind(DataBindingContext.java:322)
	at org.eclipse.jface.internal.databinding.provisional.DataBindingContext.bind(DataBindingContext.java:356)
